content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-027-24-B
|Item_parent=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Item_parent_short=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the risk of bacterial vaginosis during pregnancy
|Description=Risk of threatened premature delivery
|Section=Follow-up and/or prognosis
|Contributors=Alexandre Vivanti, Philippe Deruelle
|Order=24}}
Bacterial vaginosis has been suspected of favouring premature delivery. This risk is currently being called into question.

question.question: What is the current status of the suspected risk of bacterial vaginosis in relation to premature delivery?
question.option_a: Bacterial vaginosis is definitively proven to cause premature delivery.
question.option_b: The risk of bacterial vaginosis leading to premature delivery is currently being called into question.
question.option_c: Bacterial vaginosis has no impact on the risk of premature delivery.
question.option_d: The risk of bacterial vaginosis leading to premature delivery has been definitively ruled out.
